taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Description
dataObjects.title: General Description
dataObjects.description:
From Boulenger (1909) p. 118-119.

Depth of body 4 to 4½ times in total length, length of head 4 to 4 1/3 times. Upper profile of head descending in a strong curve; snout much prolonged, tubiform, strongly compressed, curved downwards, its length 1 2/3 to 2 times postocular part of head, and 4 to 5 times its least depth, which nearly equals diameter of eye; latter 2/3 to 3/4 interorbital width; lower jaw with a compressed dermal appendage about as long as the eye; teeth conical, 3 in upper jaw, 4 in lower. Dorsal 26-30, originating above 6th to 8th ray of anal, its length 1½ to 1 4/5 times in its distance from head. Anal 29-34, nearer base of caudal than base of ventral. Pectoral obtusely pointed, 3/5 to 2/3 length of head, ventral 1/3 to 2/5; pectoral extending beyond base of ventral. Caudal densely scaled, with pointed lobes. Caudal peduncle 3½ times as long as deep, 2/3 to 3/4 length of head. 70-80 scales in lateral line, 12-18 / 19-21 in transverse series on body, 14-15 / 12-15 in transverse series between dorsal and anal, 12 round caudal peduncle. Brownish above; a rather indistinct dark, light edged vertical band between origin of dorsal and anal.

Total length 360 millim.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Its electric organ discharge (EOD) is steroid-sensitive (Ref. 10763; 10764).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Africa:  Volta, Niger, Tchad, Shari and Congo basins (Ref. 3203).
dataObjects.references: Gosse, J.-P. 1984 Mormyridae. p. 63-122. In J. Daget, J.-P. Gosse and D.F.E. Thys van den Audenaerde (eds.) Check-list of the freshwater fishes of Africa (CLOFFA). ORSTOM, Paris and MRAC, Tervuren. Vol. 1. (Ref. 3203)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.title: Distribution
dataObjects.description: A very widespread species. Type is from the Niger River in West Africa. Also in the Volta,Tchad, Shari and Congo basins. See FishBase for museum holdings and localities.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Morphology
dataObjects.description: Dorsal spines (total): 0; Dorsal soft rays (total): 28 - 31;  Analspines: 0; Analsoft rays: 31 - 35

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.description: 43.0 cm SL (male/unsexed; (Ref. 2915)); max. published weight: 500 g (Ref. 3799)
dataObjects.references: Ita, E.O. 1984 Kainji (Nigeria). p. 43-103. In J.M. Kapetsky and T. Petr (eds.) Status of African reservoir fisheries. CIFA Tech. Pap. 10:326 p. (Ref. 3799)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: Young with dark band across body between anterior end of dorsal and anal which widens in the center and surrounded by a clear zone on each side in the form of a parenthesis; first dorsal and anal ray marked with black; this coloration disappears in individuals > 20 cm; Dorsal origin behind origin of anal fin; body depth 3.9-4.7 x SL; head length 3-5 x SL; head 2.3-3.3x longer than large.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Environment
dataObjects.description: demersal; freshwater; pH range: 5.0 - 7.0; dH range: 5

dataObjects.title: File:MormyrusJury.jpg
dataObjects.description: # Mormyrus tamandua = Campylomormyrus tamandua (Günther, 1864) # Mormyrus petersii = Gnathonemus petersii (Günther, 1864) English: Elephantnose Fish (above); Wormjawed Mormyrid (below)

dataObjects.title: File:Electric fish and EODs.png
dataObjects.description: English: 1=Recorded in South Africa by Carl Hopkins from Cornell University. EOD wave is presented as recorded in a head-positive/ tail-negative fashion.  * Campylomormyrus tshokwe species 1 (at the top) * Campylomormyrus sp. A species 2 * Campylomormyrus sp. C species 3 (looks like an error: it should be sp. B) * Campylomormyrus sp. C species 4 * Campylomormyrus rhynchophorus species 5 * Campylomormyrus sp. D species 6 * Campylomormyrus numenius species 7 * Campylomormyrus tamandua species 8 * Campylomormyrus sp. E species 9 * Campylomormyrus phantasticus species 10 (at the bottom)
